answers.answer: if you had a negative IgG test at 18 weeks, that's reliable proof that you don't have herpes.i'm not a herpes expert, but your symptoms don't sound anything like a "typical" herpes outbreak. also, from what i've researched, herpes never just goes on constantly for that long. it comes and goes
Thanks for you reply. I sure hope so because it's driving me crazy. Going to the Derm on Mon keep your fingers crossed.

i definitely know how you feel, i've been driving myself absolutely crazy over a similar t hing for about 9 weeks now.  but trust me, it's super, super SUPER rare for someone with herpes not to have seroconverted by 18 weeks. the very latest is usually about 16 weeks, and that's even rare. have you been tested for other stds?
Yes I had the Doctor to do a complete blood work up and everything came back negative except my Diabetes.
ah ok. well, frustrating that they don't know what's wrong, but nice to know you're STD free! :)

question: I had a sexual incounter at the end of July. The last week in August I started having syntoms of a sexually transmitted disease. In The last week in September I started with this genital itching and sometimes a sharp pain at the head of my penis, no rashes. This has been going on since then. I have had a HSV IgG test for both 1 & 2. I had negative results form this 18 week problem. CAn you have a Herpes outbreak for that long with constant itching is the problem on my scrotum, penis and sometimes it seems to be inside my penis. I also have Diabetes and my Doc said it could be yeast.
title: Is this Herpes???
